snippet: The company’s bundling of its mapping technology with the iPhone 5 brings to mind the Microsoft-Netscape antitrust battles of the 1990s.
abstract: The company’s bundling of its mapping technology with the iPhone 5 brings to mind the Microsoft-Netscape antitrust battles of the 1990s.
lead_paragraph: The company’s bundling of its mapping technology with the iPhone 5 brings to mind the Microsoft-Netscape antitrust battles of the 1990s, writes James B. Stewart in his Common Sense column in The New York Times. Read more »

headline.main: The Shadow of Steve Jobs in Apple’s Maps Problem
